SENT.plain: Five case histories of intra-thoracic involvement occurring in the course of Behcet's disease were studied
These included a superior vena caval obstruction, an obstructive syndrome, transitory infiltrates, repeated lung infections and a case of haemoptysis
A review of the literature was carried out "Ã propos" of each case

The advantage of specialised investigations such as pulmonary angiography, perfusion scintigraphy and bronchial arteriography is underlined
